name: Paper Dosa
history: Paper Dosa is a thinner and crisper version of the traditional South Indian dosa. It is known for its large size, thin texture, and light weight, resembling a sheet of paper.
description: Paper Dosa is an ultra-thin and crisp dosa made from a fermented rice and lentil batter. It's larger and thinner than regular dosas and is often served as a wrap with various fillings.

equipment.name: spatula
equipment.description: For spreading and flipping the dosas.

ingredients.quantity: for grinding and adjusting batter consistency

instructions.title: Prepare Dosa Batter
instructions.description: Soak the parboiled rice, urad dal, and fenugreek seeds in water for at least 6 hours or overnight. Drain the water and grind the mixture in a blender or grinder to make a smooth batter. Add water gradually to achieve a pourable consistency. The batter should be slightly thick and not runny. Allow the batter to ferment in a warm place for 8-10 hours or until it doubles in volume.

instructions.title: Make the Paper Dosa
instructions.description: Heat a large griddle or tawa over medium-high heat. Once hot, pour a ladleful of the fermented batter onto the center of the griddle. Quickly spread the batter in a circular motion using the back of the ladle to form a very thin crepe.

instructions.title: Crisp the Dosa
instructions.description: Drizzle a few drops of oil around the edges of the dosa. Cook until the underside turns golden brown and the dosa is crisp. The edges should start to lift from the griddle.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Carefully fold the dosa and remove it from the griddle. Serve immediately with chutney and sambar. Repeat with the remaining batter to make more paper dosas.

tips: Maintain a high heat to ensure the dosa becomes thin and crisp.
Use a non-stick tawa or well-seasoned iron griddle for the best results.
variations: For a masala dosa variation, add a filling of spiced potatoes.
Experiment with adding finely chopped onions or grated carrots to the batter for extra flavor.

storage.shelfLife: The batter can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store the batter in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Stir well before using.

reheatingInstructions.instruction: Reheat the dosa on a hot griddle for a few minutes until warm and crispy.

presentationTips: Serve on a large plate, as paper dosas are typically quite big.
Garnish with a sprig of curry leaves or coriander for a fresh look.
